author: {'steamid': '76561198349857022', 'num_games_owned': 3008, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1690218616}
review:
[h1] Repetitive and Uninspired [/h1] 

Doodler is a free platformer and that's all it really has going for it. If this was a paid game it wouldn't be worth your money or your time and as a free game it still isn't worth your time. There's tons of levels but so many of them are exactly like the other levels you've already played or are so uninspired and boring that you'll be wishing you didn't waste your time playing it. The game can be beaten in just around an hour but even then after finishing it I wished I had spent that time playing anything else. The graphics are just meh, the controls feel clunky and not sharp enough and the levels are like every other basic 2D platformer out there. Save your time and play something else instead. For more reviews, follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40795588/] curator page. [/url]

review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Kostenloser Puzzle Platformer

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Es gibt viele verschiedene kurze Level (knapp √ºber 100) in denen wir immer einen Bleistift finden m√ºssen um ins n√§chste Level zu kommen. Manche Level sind sehr simpel und andere sind etwas kniffliger, aber man braucht nie viel nach zu denken um auf die richtige L√∂sung zu kommen. Unser Charakter wird sogar immer √Ñlter dabei (f√§ngt als Kind an und wird sp√§ter zum alten Mann) was ein recht nettes Feature ist. Es gibt auch einen Level Editor der relativ simpel zu bedienen ist. Man kann auch selbst gemachte Level von anderen Spielern via Steam Workshop herunterladen.

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 9 Erfolge. 1 Erfolg bekommt man f√ºrs starten des Spiels, 4 gibt es f√ºrs durchspielen. Die anderen gibt es f√ºr eine bestimmte Anzahl an Tode & Spr√ºnge, 1 Stunde im Spiel verbringen und das Spiel am 23 Juli spielen (Tag an dem der Entwickler angefangen hat).

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Kostenlos
+ Nette Grafik
+ Gute Musik
+ Gut gestaltete Level
+ Level Editor
+ Steam Workshop Support
+ XBox 360 Controller Support
+ Achievements

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein Liebevoller Puzzle Plattformer mit Guter Grafik und nettem Level Design. Auf jeden Fall zu Empfehlen zumal es Kostenlos ist

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1532395488}
review:
[h1]A basic platformer game with a sandbox.[/h1]

In a nutshell, that's all [i]Doodler[/i] is.  "Story-wise" (if you can say there's a story...really various collections in levels) have your main character, presumably an artist, looking for his pencil...that's about it.  The pencil is the goal.  Along the way, you need to venture forth, avoid traps, hit switches, you know...the usual platformer stuff with very light puzzle stuff thrown in.  Not much else I can say about [i]Doodler[/i]...

Graphics are decent, gameplay is decent...just about everything is decent, but this game isn't memorable.  It's free, so try it out if you don't really have anything else to do....or don't.  Either way, you're not really missing much.

5/10  Yeah...I know the review's kinda' generic, but there's really not much else to say...

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674597', 'num_games_owned': 2061, 'num_reviews': 607, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1533511923}
review:
Doodler is a free platformer game in which you control a little guy as he goes through life. There's four chapters tied to four stages of life (childhood, teenage years, adulthood, old age), but other than changing character models and backgrounds, there's not a lot of difference between levels. And while talking about levels, I must say they felt pretty repetitive; the game's page boasts about 100+ pre-made levels, but they didn't really feel that varied; at times I felt I was replaying a previous level with only slight changes.

Another issue I had with the game is the movement. I can't quite explain it, but it felt "sloppy". When jumping, for example, the fall speed of your character is pretty slow, and at times, when walking it feels as if he was sliding.

Overall, it's not a pretty good game in my opinion. I'm pretty sure the Workshop content might lead to some more interesting levels, but what the game offers is pretty poor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035285721', 'num_games_owned': 5118, 'num_reviews': 1098, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1517703497}
review:
[h1] A doodle's life [/h1]
Quite delightful 2d sidescrolling puzzle platformer. And it's F2P. There are 4 worlds connected to the life phases. Doodler is aging which is also shown in the level themes. Not too challenging puzzles, not to hard if you know the doublejump (W + arrow up) and the graphics are sometimes colorful but not very amazing ... just simplistic sketchy style. Also liked the soundtrack. Only to play for 1 hour without interruption I missed. Hope I can idle it in the end. The level editor is amazing but I only used it for the upload achievement. Well done for a free title.

review:

* * POSITIVOS * * 

- Muy buena m√∫sica

* * NEGATIVOS * *

- El juego presume de poder jugar los niveles de otros creadores, pero no hay una secci√≥n espec√≠fica dentro del juego para jugar de inmediato a los niveles, te manda a la comunidad de Steam, y ya no supe que hacer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077577988', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1471032652}
review:
At first I was extremely sceptical about this game and it's design, thinking that it would be just another basic platformer but much to my suprise "doodler" felt very refreshing for it's genre. The game feels easy enough to play while drinking a beer after a long day but also offers challanges that will make you sit on the edge of your chair. The layed back music and aesthetic misleads it's players to believe they will be lead on a fun ride but little do they know it can take a turn for the worst. I cannot wait to put more hours into this game, Although the "story" mode seems like it's labeled that for show, it's still very enjoyable to see what is possible to make. The real treasure is in the creative mode allowing you to create anything you want. It has  a very nice UserInterface that is easy to learn. You are able to share the maps you make with workshop and download maps that the commmunity has made, over all the game can offer never ending levels. It's easy to lose your sense of time while playing this game.  
8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198151318927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1472353904}
